page.title: 02CUSTOMS
page.content: {Religious:}Christian festivals of Easter, Christmas plus Harvest Thanks- giving when the church is decorated with produce and flowers and then given to the elderly or sick. {Folk:}Hallowe'en on 31st. Oct.is celebrated by children making turnip lanterns and visiting homes 'guising'. They disguise themselves, sing and recite poetry for fruit and nut reward Auld Year's night is celebrated by visiting neighbours to wish them Happy New Year. This is called first footing and one's first foot should be dark and have a gift of a lump of coal to ensure prosperity to the house in the new year.{ {Historical:}5th Nov we celebrate Guy Fawkes by burning a Guy on a bonfire and setting off fireworks. Burns Supper 25th Jan to rember Rabbie Burns and his poetry
